metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7885 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The dgnc_mgmt_ioctl function in drivers/staging/dgnc/dgnc_mgmt.c in the Linux kernel through 4.3.3 does not initialize a certain structure member, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory via a crafted application. It was discovered that the driver for Digi Neo and ClassicBoard devices did not properly initialize data structures. A local attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information from the kernel.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-73-generic - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-lowlatency - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-3.13.0-73-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-73.116
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-73-generic - 3.13.0-73.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-56-generic - 3.16.0-56.75~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-56-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-56.75~14.04.1
linux-image-3.16.0-56-lowlatency - 3.16.0-56.75~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-73.116').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
